business.headline: Gold jumps nearly Rs 1,000, silver surges Rs 4,000: Time to invest or wait for a dip?After several weeks of uncertainty, gold and silver are now moving higher with steady gains. This has boosted market sentiment, but it has also left many wondering whether to buy now or wait for more favourable prices.

How Hyderabad's love for biryani exposed a nationwide multi-crore tax scamIn India, biryani is more than food. It is an emotion that finally left a trail too big to hide. Read on to find out how it exposed a nationwide multi-crore tax scam.

8th Pay Commission: When will you get your arrears and salary hike?Central government employees and pensioners are closely watching every update on the 8th Pay Commission. The big questions remain, i.e., when will the new pay structure be implemented, and when will arrears actually reach your bank account?

IMF chief says India well-positioned in AI race thanks to digital infrastructureAccording to Kristalina Georgieva, India is in a strong position due to its early investment in digital public infrastructure, which now forms the base for wider AI access.

How a biryani billing trail exposed tax scam; Rs 70,000 crore sales hiddenWhat began as a simple I-T review of biryani restaurant bills turned into a sweeping hunt for Rs 70,000 crore in suppressed sales buried across the country.

Why has this Dutch company's stock gained over 90% on Nasdaq in six months?ASML Holding's stock has gained 94.66% in the past six months on the US stock exchange Nasdaq, where many of the world's biggest technology companies list their shares.

Infosys, Tech Mahindra, TCS: Why IT stocks are falling again todayThe slide in IT stocks raises fresh questions about what is spooking investors and how long this uneasy phase could last. A closer look may reveal more than the morning numbers suggest.

Sensex, Nifty open flat amid volatility, IT stocks continue to declineWith global cues expected to remain volatile, investors are likely to stay cautious. Movements in crude oil, the rupee and developments in the US–Iran standoff will remain key drivers for market direction through the day.

UK and India must shape AI together, says Kanishka NarayanIn an exclusive conversation with India Today, UK AI Minister Kanishka Narayan highlighted the strengthening technological partnership between India and the United Kingdom.

BNW Developments partners with Radisson Hotel Group for hotel and residencesThe development will include the Radisson Blu Hotel, RAK Central, with 361 rooms, and Radisson Blu Residences, RAK Central, with 222 branded homes.
India well-positioned to lead in AI: Sam Altman at AI Impact SummitOpenAI CEO Sam Altman hailed India's rapid progress in 'sovereign AI' and said it's well-positioned to lead in AI.
Sensex closes 1,236 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; IndiGo down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 1,236.11 points to close at 82,498.14, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 365 points to end at 25,454.35.
Sensex down 1,200 points: 3 reasons why the stock market is falling todayAt the closing bell, the Sensex was down 1236.11 points at 82,498.14, while the Nifty50 had slipped 365 points to 25,454.35.

Investing in IPOs? Your money may be funding the promoter, not the companyAccording to a detailed study by 1 Finance Magazine, which analysed more than 1,700 IPOs between 2015 and 2025, 63% of total IPO proceeds now come from Offer for Sale. Only 37% is fresh capital raised for business growth.

Infosys down 18% in a month, TCS falls 14%: Is it an opportunity to buy IT stocks?IT stocks have corrected sharply, but is this panic justified? Before you decide to sell or buy the dip, here's what the AI shift and global slowdown really mean for investors.

SpiceJet signs MoU for 10 aircraft, targets major capacity ramp-upThe development comes just days after the board approved a calibrated fleet ramp-up to 60 aircraft through a mix of wet and damp leases, along with the phased return of previously grounded planes.

Gold, silver prices drop sharply. Are they still a safe bet for investors?Gold and silver prices have dipped, but does that mean the rally is over? Experts explain what the recent correction really signals and why many investors still see strength ahead.

OpenAI eyeing $100 billion funding round, but why does it need so much money?The $100 billion funding is linked to three major areas: infrastructure spending, expanding artificial intelligence tools, and deeper partnerships for chips and cloud computing.

Infosys, TCS, HCLTech: Why are major IT stocks rising today?The rebound follows a difficult few weeks for the sector. IT stocks had been under sustained pressure amid fears that rapid advances in artificial intelligence could disrupt traditional outsourcing and software services models.
Sensex, Nifty open marginally higher as IT stocks rally; HCLTech up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 154.21 points to 83,888.46, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 47.45 points to 25,866.80 as of 9:22 am.

entertainment.headline: Big fan of Dhanush: Mrunal Thakur sets record straight on romance rumours Actress Mrunal Thakur dismisses ongoing speculation about her relationship with Dhanush, saying she is simply a fan of the actor and wishes to collaborate with him in the future.

Navya Naveli Nanda opens up about trolls: I have faced my fair share of hate Navya Naveli Nanda opened up about dealing with online hate, saying she chooses not to let social media shape her self-worth.

Actor Imran Khan's partner Lekha Washington reacts to Love Jihad remarks Actor Imran Khan's partner, Lekha Washington, addressed criticism received after their public appearance at the premiere of Happy Patel: Khatarnak Jasoos. She also discussed the trolling, her multicultural background, and self-identity.

Shakira to headline Feeding India Concert 2026 in Mumbai and Delhi Global icon Shakira will headline the Feeding India Concert 2026 in Mumbai and Delhi. The concert aims to raise awareness on child nutrition and support the UN's Zero Hunger goal by 2030.

Dhurandhar 2 not cleared by censors yet. Here's the truth behind viral certificate Dhurandhar 2 has not yet been submitted to the censor board amid online speculation over its certification and runtime. Read on to find out the truth behind the viral CBFC certificate linked to the Dhurandhar sequel.

Rajkummar Rao shares sweet birthday note for wife Patralekhaa: Heart of our home Rajkummar Rao wrote an emotional birthday note for wife Patralekhaa, calling her the "best thing that has ever happened" to him and sharing glimpses of their journey together.

Macron's India farewell video has a Dhurandhar twist, internet calls it 'goated' Emmanuel Macron's farewell video from India featured moments from his visit and uses the title track from Dhurandhar, drawing attention and reactions online.

Delhi High Court protects Kajol's personality rights, orders obscene content removal The Delhi High Court has granted interim protection to Kajol's personality rights, restraining misuse of her name, image, and likeness for commercial gain.

Hrithik Roshan calls Shahid Kapoor too good in O' Romeo: You do this genre best Hrithik Roshan praised Shahid Kapoor's performance in O' Romeo, calling him "too good" in the genre. The film, which released in theatres on February 13, stars Shahid alongside Triptii Dimri, Avinash Tiwary and others.

Actor Trisha visits Tirupati temple, calls it the best day. See pics, video Actress Trisha Krishnan visited the Sri Venkateswara Temple in Tirupati, sharing photos from her visit and reflecting on the significance of the experience. She posted a series of photos on her Instagram page.

Eric Dane dies at 53: Kevin McKidd to Alyssa Milano, Hollywood celebs pay tribute Hollywood stars paid tribute to Eric Dane after the Grey's Anatomy and Euphoria actor died at 53 following a battle with ALS. Co-stars including Kevin McKidd, Alyssa Milano and Nina Dobrev remembered him for his humour and kindness.

Kritika Kamra and Gaurav Kapur to marry on March 11 in private ceremony Actors Kritika Kamra and Gaurav Kapur will marry in a private ceremony on March 11 in Mumbai, with family and close friends in attendance.

Raakshasa review: A well-written crime thriller led by Vijay RaghavendraRelease Date:Fri Feb 20, 2026 Raakshasa series review: The Kannada crime thriller web series from Zee5 stars Vijay Raghavendra in the lead and presents an intriguing string of cases to solve, all of which hint at crocodile attacks but runs deeper.

Ranveer Singh gets Rs 10 crore extortion note; Bishnoi gang, US number under lens The Bishnoi gang allegedly demanded Rs 10 crore from Ranveer Singh through a threatening voice note sent from an American number. Mumbai Crime Branch has launched a preliminary enquiry into the case.

Heated Rivalry review: Hudson-Connor's queer romance raises the heat and the barRelease Date:Fri Feb 20, 2026 Heated Rivalry series review: Heated Rivalry brings a fearless queer romance to Indian screens with a unique ice hockey setting. The series delves into themes of desire, denial and vulnerability in a hypermasculine world.

Eric Dane's wife Rebecca's last post on his struggle, family's strength resurfaces Eric Dane, known for roles in Euphoria and Grey's Anatomy, died at the age of 53 following a battle with ALS. His wife earlier wrote an essay, describing his struggle and her decision to stand by him as family.

Toxic teaser: Yash builds an empire of fear in gritty crime saga set in Goa The teaser of Toxic: A Fairytale for Grown-Ups marks Yash's return to the big screen after KGF: Chapter 2, introducing a dark crime saga set in mid-20th century Goa.

Kennedy review: Anurag Kashyap's crime drama grips but lacks full impactRelease Date:Fri Feb 20, 2026 Anurag Kashyap's Kennedy explores power and moral erosion in a post-pandemic setting. The film's chilling performances highlight a dark, unsettling world yet lack full narrative cohesion. Here's our review.

Director MM Baig, who helped Hrithik Roshan with diction, found dead at Mumbai home Hindi film director MM Baig, father of former child actor Baby Guddu, was found dead at his residence earlier this week. He helped Hrithik Roshan with his diction and voice modulation before the actor's debut.

general news.headline: Youth Congress members detained at AI Summit after shirtless protest  against PMDelhi saw a bold shirtless protest by Youth Congress workers against PM Narendra Modi during the AI Summit. Authorities have initiated strict legal action as political tensions escalate in the capital.

Communal unrest grips 3 states: What happened in MP, Karnataka, AndhraCommunal tensions flared up across three states in quick succession during different religious events on Thursday. A Durga temple complex was allegedly vandalised in Jabalpur, leading to a flare-up, while stone-pelting was reported in Karnataka and Hyderabad during Shivaji Jayanti processions.

Typos to Trump sidelining him: Pakistan PM's 'summit of humiliation'At Donald Trump's first Gaza Board of Peace meeting, Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif was isolated and sidelined, cutting a lonely figure at the event where Islamabad sought to project its so-called global relevance. Is there a silent friction between Trump and Pakistan?

How Hyderabad's love for biryani exposed a nationwide multi-crore tax scamIn India, biryani is more than food. It is an emotion that finally left a trail too big to hide. Read on to find out how it exposed a nationwide multi-crore tax scam.

Tata Punch EV facelift launched at Rs 9.69 lakh with claimed 355-km range  Live UpdatesTata Motors has launched the updated Tata Punch EV in India from Rs 9.69 lakh, introducing subtle design tweaks, a new 40kWh battery option and a claimed 355km real-world range.

Live: Student-friendly Physics paper, moderate levelCBSE Class 12 Physics Board Exam Live Updates: Mixed reactions have emerged after the Class 12 Physics paper concluded, with teachers, HODs, and students sharing varied assessments of its difficulty and structure. While several educators described the paper as balanced, moderate, and aligned with the CBSE syllabus, others noted that lengthy numericals and multi-step calculations made it time-consuming for many students. Some students said the paper tested conceptual understanding and application, while others found it challenging to complete within the given time. Here are the latest updates.

How Iran-linked oil tanker seized by India went dark after entering Pak's sea zoneMT Asphalt Star, one of the three Iran-linked tankers seized near Mumbai, was detected operating suspiciously in Pakistan's Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ). On January 28, the tanker went completely "dark" for about 11 hours, disabling its Automatic Identification System, Very High Frequency radio and onboard sensors, while concealing its identity.

Why Bangladesh's secular Constitution begins by invoking AllahTwo events have brought Bangladesh's Constitution back into focus. The recent elections that made Tarique Rahman the Prime Minister, and the approval of the July Charter referendum, mandating fresh constitutional changes. It was Tarique's father, Ziaur Rahman, who altered the original secular framework and legalised religion-based politics. Now Bangladesh's Constitution straddles a duality.

AI is very thirsty, and it only wants fresh water. Here's whyData centres are consuming billions of gallons of fresh water to keep AI servers cool. This rising demand poses a significant threat to local water supplies in drought-prone regions.

India signs Pax Silica declaration, joins US initiative on AI, critical mineralsJoining Pax Silica could help India reduce its heavy reliance on China for rare earth imports while strengthening resilient supply chains for critical minerals and artificial intelligence.

Nasa tags Sunita Williams' flight as a disaster, like Kalpana Chawla'sNasa has released a final report on the Boeing Starliner mission that left Sunita Williams stranded. The agency has officially classified the failure as a serious Type A mishap, the most serious label the agency can give to an accident.

After 11,000 layoffs, Accenture says use AI at work or else no appraisal for youAccenture has reportedly informed senior employees that their promotions will now be linked to AI usage. This comes at a time when Microsoft, Google and Meta have given similar notifications as the industry shifts focus to an AI-driven future.

Anxious at 40: 49% Millennials fear layoffs. But they are built to endureNearly half of Millennials fear AI could replace their jobs within five years. Yet this is the same generation that survived recessions, startup crashes and a pandemic. Why is the most crisis-tested workforce suddenly anxious at 40? Are they truly insecure, or just realistic? The data reveals the paradox of resilient yet insecure mid-career professionals.

Taliban legalises domestic violence, permits beatings till no bones brokenWomen are treated in the new penal code as being on the same level as "slaves", with provisions allowing either "slave masters" or husbands to administer discretionary punishment, including beatings, to their wives or subordinates. This aspect of the code has drawn particular alarm from rights groups.

How a biryani billing trail exposed tax scam; Rs 70,000 crore sales hiddenWhat began as a simple I-T review of biryani restaurant bills turned into a sweeping hunt for Rs 70,000 crore in suppressed sales buried across the country.

Teen critical after live-in partner assaults her in Gurugram during fight over marriage plansAccording to police, the woman, a biotechnology student at a university in Gurugram, had been living with the accused after they met in September 2025. They were reportedly discussing marriage, with talks initiated between the families.

Video: Man sets bike on fire when stopped from smoking at petrol pump in RaipurCCTV footage shows two men arriving at the petrol pump in Raipur when one of them tried to light a cigarette even as petrol was being dispensed onto their bike.

From Sunak to Sriram, everyone wants India to use American AI. But should India?At the India AI Impact Summit, Western companies are pitching themselves as AI producers and they want Indians to be AI consumers. This reflects in statements from White House policy advisor Sriram to Rishi Sunak to Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei. India should keep an open mind on it, and Sarvam in its sight.

Khaled Hosseini, red lipstick, sojne phul: Bengal woman's village life goes globalMeet Pujarini Pradhan - a small-town woman from rural Bengal whose quiet, English-spoken glimpses of everyday village life have turned simplicity into a following of over half a million on Instagram.

IMF chief says India well-positioned in AI race thanks to digital infrastructureAccording to Kristalina Georgieva, India is in a strong position due to its early investment in digital public infrastructure, which now forms the base for wider AI access.
India's first food allergy rules: Feed peanuts early, know real vs intoleranceNew national guidelines describe how India should diagnose, prevent and manage food allergies in children

After Pak denies abduction claim, Baloch rebels release video of captive soldiers'I fought for Pakistan, and today the Pakistani Army does not acknowledge me,' one of the alleged soldiers in Baloch rebel custody can be heard saying in the video.

Video: Fire at Hyderabad coaching hub, 90 students inside as smoke engulfs floorsThe blaze erupted while 90 students were attending classes in the coaching centre. Within minutes, thick smoke engulfed corridors and classrooms, leaving students in panic and struggling to escape.

Shakira to headline Feeding India Concert 2026 in Mumbai and DelhiGlobal icon Shakira will headline the Feeding India Concert 2026 in Mumbai and Delhi. The concert aims to raise awareness on child nutrition and support the UN's Zero Hunger goal by 2030.

sports.headline: Told to rest Babar, I was forced to resign as Pakistan selector: Mohammad Yousuf T20 World Cup: Mohammad Yousuf revealed that he was forced to resign from his role as Pakistan selector in 2024 after suggesting that Babar Azam should be dropped from T20Is. Babar has struggled for form during the T20 World Cup 2026.

T20 World Cup: Is IND vs PAK on the decline? Viewership numbers suggest otherwise T20 World Cup 2026: India vs Pakistan T20 World Cup match shatters viewership records with 163 million digital reach, the highest for any ICC T20 event, despite pre-tournament boycott drama and India's dominant 8-1 record.

Watch: Shubman Gill goes full throttle in IPL prep, leaves T20 World Cup snub behind A viral nets video showed Shubman Gill in destructive touch ahead of IPL 2026. After a tough international phase and a T20 World Cup snub, the Gujarat Titans captain appeared focused on reset, rhythm and response.

Fifty years of blunders: How the ICC keeps getting the World Cup format wrong For over five decades, the ICC has repeatedly reshaped World Cup formats in the name of innovation, often sacrificing clarity and competitive integrity. From Super Six confusion to modern pre-seeding chaos, cricket's biggest tournament keeps solving problems it creates.

The Hundred auction: Joe Root, Adil Rashid among big names to go under hammer Joe Root and Adil Rashid are among the big names who are set to go under the hammer during the first-ever Hundred auction, with all 16 franchises looking to snap up big talent before the new season.

Hardik Pandya at No.5 right or wrong? Mohammed Kaif questions India's batting order T20 World Cup: Mohammed Kaif has questioned Hardik Pandya's promotion to No.5 despite India's unbeaten run. With the Super 8s looming, India's left-heavy batting order and tactical tweaks are back under the spotlight.

Here by chance, gave it my all: Trott bids farewell to Afghanistan cricket T20 World Cup: An emotional Jonathan Trott bid farewell to Afghanistan cricket, saying that he is proud of his players and will remain a fan of them forever. Having got the chance to be the coach by luck, Trott guided Afghanistan to the semi-final stage of the T20 World Cup 2024.

From next Yuvraj to main man: Shivam Dube owning the T20 World Cup stage T20 World Cup: After being compared to Yuvraj Singh in his early days, Shivam Dube is producing a performance like the Indian legend on the T20 World Cup stage. With improved batting and bowling skills, Dube could be the difference for India in their bid to regain their crown.

Jonathan Trott left in tears talking about Afghanistan turnaround: Watch T20 World Cup: Jonathan Trott was unable to hold back his tears in his final press conference as Afghanistan coach. Trott performed a remarkable turnaround to change Afghanistan's fortunes.

Jonathan Trott: The messiah who nurtured Afghanistan like his own T20 World Cup 2026, AFG vs CAN: Jonathan Trott has taken Afghanistan cricket to greater heights and ended his tenure as head coach following the group match against Canada on Thursday at the MA Chidambaram Stadium.

From torn shoes to towering six: Ryan Burl's chapter in Zimbabwe's T20 World Cup tale T20 World Cup: From a viral 2021 torn-shoes post to a 103-metre six in Colombo, Ryan Burl's journey mirrors Zimbabwe's T20 World Cup revival. His all-round impact has helped power them into the Super 8s.

After Abhishek Sharma slogger remark, Amir warns India opener amid poor formT20 World Cup: After calling Abhishek Sharma a slogger, Mohammad Amir has sent a warning to the Indian opener amidst his poor run of form in the T20 World Cup. Abhishek is yet to get off the mark in the competition, scoring three consecutive ducks.

Mesut Ozil's convoy involved in road accident during Bangladesh tourA vehicle in Mesut Ozil's convoy was involved in a road accident in Cox's Bazar during his Bangladesh visit. The former Germany star was unharmed as authorities launched an investigation into the incident.

T20 World Cup: India must solve familiar off-spin question as Super 8 test loomsT20 World Cup: Defending champions India have entered the Super 8s unbeaten in the ongoing ICC tournament. On paper, they remain overwhelming title contenders. On the field, however, a quieter subplot has begun to gather weight—India's vulnerability against off-spin.

Jasprit Bumrah, Varun Chakravarthy to be the difference makers in IND vs SA: PollockT20 World Cup: Shaun Pollock believes Jasprit Bumrah and Varun Chakravarthy hold the edge for India ahead of the Super 8 clash vs South Africa. The former Proteas captain sees the duo as the real point of difference.

Shadab Khan is Mike Hesson's laadla: Ex-Pak batter slams all-rounder over India remarkFormer Pakistan batter Basit Ali hit back at Shadab Khan for the all-rounder's pointed remark about former Pakistan cricketers. Shadab's claim that none of the former Pakistan players criticising the current side had managed to beat India in a World Cup has sparked controversy.

Ibrahim Zadran dedicates POTM award to departing Afghanistan coach TrottAfghanistan opener Ibrahim Zadran capped his ICC Men's T20 World Cup campaign on a high, dedicating his Player of the Match award to outgoing head coach Jonathan Trott following an emphatic 82-run victory over Canada on Thursday.

Afghanistan give Jonathan Trott a happy farewell with dominant win vs CanadaT20 World Cup, AFG vs CAN: Afghanistan beat Canada by 82 runs at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai to finish their campaign on a positive note. The Afghans also gave their head coach, Jonathan Trott, a happy farewell.

Hundred teams co-owned by IPL franchises may not consider Pak players in auctionPakistan cricketers could miss out on contracts with franchises co-owned by Indian Premier League stakeholders in the upcoming season of The Hundred, with reports suggesting that these teams may not consider them in next month's player auction.

Australia faltered in all three facets, unfair to blame only bowlers: Andrew McDonaldT20 World Cup, AUS vs OMA: Speaking to the reporters before the match against Oman, head coach Andrew McDonald said that Australia underperformed in all three departments of the game and it would be unfair to only blame the bowlers.

Devastated Australia strive for motivation in face-saving Oman clashT20 World Cup 2026, AUS vs OMA: Andrew McDonald admitted Australia are devastated after their group-stage exit from the T20 World Cup 2026 but urged the team to reset and focus on finishing strongly against Oman.

Ranji final at Hubballi due to safety works at Chinnaswamy: Karnataka AssociationThe Karnataka State Cricket Association on Thursday confirmed that the Ranji Trophy final between Karnataka and Jammu and Kashmir will be held in Hubballi, as officials aim to fast-track ongoing safety upgrade work at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium.

Real Madrid send 'all available evidence' to UEFA for Vinicius racism rowReal Madrid have submitted "all available evidence" to UEFA as European football's governing body investigates allegations of racist abuse made by forward Vinícius Júnior during Tuesday's Champions League clash in Lisbon.

T20 World Cup: Shai Hope explains the secret behind West Indies' clinical runWest Indies captain Shai Hope has credited clarity of roles, calm execution, and strong collective belief for his team's dominant run into the Super Eights of the T20 World Cup.

Confident Sikandar Raza plots Super 8 twist in Zimbabwe's underdog storyT20 World Cup, SL vs ZIM: Sikandar Raza said that Zimbabwe would look to carry their good form into the Super 8 after beating Sri Lanka by six wickets on Thursday in Colombo.

Zimbabwe continue dream run, stun Sri Lanka to enter Super Eight unbeatenICC T20 World Cup: Zimbabwe stunned Sri Lanka to remain unbeaten in Group B, finishing on top of a table that also featured Australia and Ireland. It was a statement performance from a side that has grown in confidence with every outing.

Karnataka enter Ranji Trophy final, to face Jammu and Kashmir in title clashKarnataka qualified for the Ranji Trophy final for the first time in 11 years after advancing based on a first-innings lead in their drawn semifinal against Uttarakhand on Thursday.

Highlights: Afghanistan secure comprehensive 82-run win over CanadaAfghanistan (AFG) vs Canada (CAN) Highlights, T20 World Cup: Afghanistan signed off with a comprehensive 82-run win over Canada in their final group clash in Chennai on Thursday.

Star Sports T20 promos: When you hire a fukra, you get a fukra adStar Sports' T20 World Cup promos reduce epic rivalries to cheap laughs, relying on lazy lines and cruel jabs. The classless hype does a disservice to fans who crave genuine cricketing drama.

Australia Women spoil Harmanpreet's landmark T20I after India's shock batting collapseINDW vs AUSW, 2nd T20I: Sophie Molineux's Australia made a stupendous comeback to draw level in the three-match series after beating Harmanpreet Kaur's India by 19 runs on Thursday at the Manuka Oval in Canberra.

Watch: Proud Harmanpreet pats her own back after historic T20I vs AustraliaINDW vs AUSW: Harmanpreet Kaur became the most-capped player in women's international cricket with 356 matches. She reached the landmark in the second T20I against Australia on Thursday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
